title: League Clamping is stupid.
body: Win 12 LP, win 12 LP, lose 24, win 11.

After analyzing the data that was given to me by oce.op.gg including your match history with statistic on every ranked player you have played over the last 2 weeks ; you are mainly vsing Silver 2 - Gold 5 . The system didn't clamp you because it was flaw , you clamped yourself by being unable to beat Silver although you thoroughly claimed that you belong in Gold 5. I have roughly collected data from your past 160 games with your win rate being 47% which barely scraped the 1:1 ratio

Before you go on about your " anomalies" stuff , I would like to say that the system did the right thing to clamp you, you don't show any sign of  doing anything remotely great, in the past 160 games, you didn't win in a 3:1 ratio , and you manage to lose more then you win over the past 160 games (not including normal, only taking ranked game into account) . The reason why you were orignally Gold 5 is because you indeed just got a lucky win streak which overall didn't improve your MMR in a slight bit

The system determine your MMR by your % win rate recently and taken account on the rank of people you vs'd . If you are vsing Silver 2 / Silver 3 with Gold 5 on your team and still manage to lose . The system then downgrade your MMR to where it think you are at , while you do win games those games were more in your favour then you think.  After every lost , the elo system mechanisim tried to match you with a team that is more likely for you to win . [51-49 odd]

If you cut off after your 10 win streak (and by looking at the score, I assume you were hard carried since you did feed more then you carry) you lost a total of 41 games and won 26 games . After such a huge MMR boost aka 10 win streak . Your MMR has tank quite significantly due to you losing more then you are winning, what the system is trying to do now is trying to put you back to where you belong which is Silver 2/3 judging by your MMR . If you can prove the system wrong , which is winning 3:1 every single times then the system won't clamp you any harder

You can't lie to statistic 160 games w/ a 47% win rate ; then 31% win rate after 10 game win streak ; Also 9 win 11 lost in the most recent 20 games with less then 50% kill contribution and 1.88 kda. 

Improve your gameplay if you deserve the rank because throughly looking at your past 160 rank games I see a "worrying trend" 

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Nya+Hop# - if you want to look at it yourself .

You stats don't really mean anything, they need to change it to show he use of the champions ranks to allow your MMR to go up and down based on how you play.

You cannot assume how well or badly someone played based on their stats alone, you need to be in each game to see how well each person performed in the given situation.

I have seen and been in games that I should have won based on my stats lone and games I should have lost based on my stats alone. You can play a tanky support and sacrifice yourself for your team, your stats look shit, but your team performs well and you win.

You can also have those games that  you have a perfect KDA and still lose, it is your attitude and how you play that determines the win or lose, not always the stats.

If I take one of my table champions in the jungle, top or mid I will very rarely lose in that role, but if I don't perform well enough to help my team I will end up losing more than winning. On the flip side, why should I sacrifice my game and how well I play in lane just to help my team who are failing hard?

It is a tough decision for Rito to allow the current form to continue, but one that is just as worrying by changing it to a personal stats based game. Although I firmly believe in personal stats more since that if one player is performing above and beyond he will always, now and forever be targeted in order to stop that team winning, it will always stay that way.

At least reward those players who can actually play so when we do get stuck with the shit players we can still walk away knowing the game was not a waste of our time.

Like the system expects me to have a 3:1 win ratio and that's to maintain stationary at a certain LP.

I can carry games but it's a 5v5 and while I'm slowly climbing, my plays don't always or even often determine the outcome of the game.

I do my best, asking me to get 4:1 win-loss ratio to climb is stupid.

If your MMR is higher than your division, you gain more than you lose.
If your MMR is lower than your division, you lose more than you gain.
If your MMR is the average for your division, you will lose/gain around the same amount.

Your MMR is probably low for your division which happens when you lose a lot of games vs people that have the average MMR for your division. Meaning, when you lose matches vs them, your MMR will decrease (along with your lp) and so you're vsing people that are way lower than your division, so that you gain less LP. Because they are lower than your division, you are expected to lead your team to victory/beat the other team. Because this should be easier for someone of your division as you're vsing people below your division, you are given less LP than you lose (since you are expected not to lose).

I'm not taking sides or anything, I'm just explaining why this is happening.

This is why you are expected to have a 4:1 win loss ratio in your following games. It wiill get your MMR back up to vs people around your skill level, which is when your LP gains/losses will improve.

I know the feel, it's happened to me before. You're not expected to maintain that 4:1 win-loss ratio forever, just until your MMR average or better for your league.

Sorry this is so long, Good luck.

All you're doing is making it more and more vulnerable and with it being "better and better" people rely on it more and it becomes more and more annoying when it makes 1 stupid choice.

Its not trying to be a "smart" system. If it was a plain ELO system you wouldnt be losing way more than you win, because you'd already be ranked way lower, in mid-low silver. The reason you can't drop back so easily if you become worse is because then people would be worried/complain about losing their season rewards and half the people would stop playing ranked when they managed to get silver or gold or whatever they're aiming for for fear of dropping back out again. 

Also " I got to Gold 5 so I belong here " is the most ridiculous statement ever. You can become worse again, your champs can get nerfed, your playstyle can change, you might stop trying as hard or focusing as much, all the other players might get comparitively better. Just because you were good enough to get to gold, doesn't mean you always will be.

Because your hidden mmr is ~S3. As JasonWazza said, you are marked as being HIGHER than your mmr, so the system doesn't want you to climb. TO stay stationary, you would drop to S3 where your mmr is then you would have 1:1 win loss to stay stationary. You're saying it's about anomalies, I have my doubts someone else saying the same things will do anything to convince you, but your visible rank is not necessarily the same as where the system has placed you. 

I'm in Gold V with an mmr of ~Gold V so to stay where I am its 1:1 win:loss. If you were in Gold V with a Plat 3 mmr it would be something like 1:2 win:loss. If you were in GV and had DV mmr then you would be skipping divs. This is how the system pushes people up who shouldn't be in lower tier divs (it happens most commonly in team ranked with players that haven't played teams before). The SAME is true of the opposite. If you are GV and have S3 mmr then its going to be about 3:1 win:loss, you're saying thats bs because it should be 1:1 to stay stationary, but it is, in your MMR not in your visible rank.

tl;dr
GV mmr + GV rank = 1:1 win:loss
P3 mmr + GV rank = 1:2~ win:loss
DV mmr + GV rank = skipping divs on promos
S3 mmr + GV rank = ~3:1 win:loss

The extra numbers go on whichever side is lower. If your mmr is lower than your rank you need more wins, if it's higher you need less. You would be sitting stationary if you dropped to S3. If you wanna stay stationary in GV you have to bring your mmr up to GV first.
